Stalkers during exploration?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Monster Rancher DS: General QA: Stalkers during exploration?

I haven't done a ton of exploration but I have noticed a few of the areas have little cut scenes where a monster of some sort is lurking around. I have found 4 of them in the jungle (i think its a naga) and 1 in the ice mountain, its a durahan. From what I have read these dont seem to be part of unlocking them, and I haven't noticed anything else coming from it, so does anyone know what these events are about?

By VenomousX on Monday, August 9, 2010 - 01:44 pm:

by that time he will be tired and give you the sword...

By Thorr on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 05:08 am:

One thing i am going to try is to split the events up into separate Errantries. Zan and Durahan can be difficult on a monster with low life simply because of the running around. I believe that you can stop the sequence after a few crystals, go home, then come back to finish.

Personally, I don't want to build my super LIFE monster yet, but I want more breeds. It's worth a try.

By Thorr on Wednesday, August 11, 2010 - 08:00 am:

GM - to answer your original question, the first 4 spots for Zan are sort of interchangeable. here are the spots (in NO ORDER)-

1) North of the pond in the square crook of the forest block above it.

2) Northeast part of the forest block above the pond

3) In the northern path loop (blocked on either end by obstacles)

4) In the southern path loop (also blocked by obstacles)


When you have found the zan in those 4 places, then do these in this order -

5) just south of the waterfall, close to the small oval of trees.

6) Spot in the path just north of the start of the map. (Northwest of the very small tree clump right at the map's beginning)

7) Right at the waterfall. Slightly north of point 5.

By GM on Wednesday, August 11, 2010 - 08:14 am:

Thanks, doc. I got me a sword that denies its existence, and what a
glorious non-sword it is.

By HappyHippo123 on Wednesday, August 11, 2010 - 04:46 pm:

Well all my testing with returning seems to say that you need to do it all in one go, i know i did the 2 blocked points in the first run but after finding both the other 2 in the second i couldnt get any of the last 3 to trigger.

By HappyHippo123 on Thursday, August 12, 2010 - 06:07 pm:

Ok change of results, while I had to do the Zan unlock all in one go I successfully got durahan with each step in different errantries. So that one is definatly possible to do in multiple parts. Also As a side note i was under the impression that you had to actually combine a monster with the items to unlock these monsters but after a bit of playing around I have successfully spawned several zans and durahans without ever using their items as combination materials.

By Thorr on Thursday, August 12, 2010 - 06:36 pm:

Once you receive the item, the breed is unlocked. You don't need to use the items. That's why I specifically say "You receive item X and breed X is unlocked" in the Unlocking threads. The breed is unlocked as soon as you complete the event.

By HappyHippo123 on Thursday, August 12, 2010 - 09:40 pm:

Ah awesome, now i feel pretty stupid about wasting my dragon horn tho, i just spawned 2 random monsters and bred them with it to "unlock" dragon. Oh well no long term damage done.

By Thorr on Friday, August 13, 2010 - 05:17 am:

The combination items are much more useful when you make a strong combo. The result is a pure breed with great stats.
